messages: b923af3197d20b3b8e45d1ce10037b54 (13:37): isn't this supposed to work? tr {border-bottom: 1px solid black}
b923af3197d20b3b8e45d1ce10037b54 (13:38): i just want a small line under the lines of the list
95f9d77df4961df199a9352b78c96750 (13:51): hi! is there possibility to set in CSS alignment of the whole table?
3c26b6648764f1ab4360aa71da5d760b (13:54): How do you mean? like every cell aligned right?
d5312b89253cb75b5bc9f9e4fb2375c7 (13:54): There's no way to have the border-top only occupy a certain width of the element it's bordering is there?
d5312b89253cb75b5bc9f9e4fb2375c7 (13:54): Oh hey Munter, lot's of changes.
95f9d77df4961df199a9352b78c96750 (13:55): I can i write <table align=center> via CSS?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (13:56): centering with css is done with margins
95f9d77df4961df199a9352b78c96750 (13:57): table{margin:0 auto} ? and the table will be centered?
b923af3197d20b3b8e45d1ce10037b54 (13:58): I want a border to appear under every row... why isn't  tr {border-bottom: 1px solid black} working? :p
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (13:59): NoWhereMan: because a tr is purely a structural element. It doesnt have a gui
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (13:59): set a border on your table cells
b923af3197d20b3b8e45d1ce10037b54 (14:00): Munter, i see a small space between each cell, so the line looks break
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (14:01): set border-collapse on the table
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (14:17): you can set background on a tr i think

5e834f18e048855b6965f030ff7275f0 (14:31): hi! is it possible to style a input submit element if the form has an id? if i do #id input {} it styles all input fields.. but i want only the submit to be styled.. is this possible?
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (14:32): phatbyte: you need to put a class or id on the input or the parent element of the input
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (14:33): do a class="btn" or class="submit" on the submit input
5e834f18e048855b6965f030ff7275f0 (14:35): flaccid i have no influence on it :(
39d471f1b903d69f7f56b038f6db7728 (14:35): i want to make a div semi transparent but not any of its children... is that possible to do without telling each child to not be transparent?
0500742f383e18cfd3c0fdd3a049409d (14:36): JakeConnor: div#tranparent * {selects all inside transparent div}
135b46f48df7cde2a26c664247e0d0b3 (14:36): tsw: is that css3 or something ?
39d471f1b903d69f7f56b038f6db7728 (14:38): tsw: thanks... is the transparent setting opacity?
0500742f383e18cfd3c0fdd3a049409d (14:38): every browser I know support it (I dont count IE as browser, its pain in the ass)
